intro: Lepidosperma triangulare, commonly known as the triangular sedges, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as swamps and marshes, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its slender stems are often triangular in cross-section, giving it its common name. Lepidosperma triangulare produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family.
